actions.text: On agreeing to the Sanders amendment (A023) Agreed to by voice vote.

description: Amendment increases funding for weatherization assistance and energy conservation programs by $45 million and reduces fossil fuel energy research and development programs accordingly.
purpose: An amendment numbered 28 printed in the Congressional Record to increase funding for efficiency investments by $45 million, including $20 million for the Weatherization Assistance Program and $3.5 million for the State Energy Program by reducing funding for the Fossil Fuel Energy Research and Development program by $45 million.
